trans-unit.source: Provides Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) statistical data.

Instances of this class are returned by the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.IPGlobalProperties.GetTcpIPv4Statistics%2A> and <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.IPGlobalProperties.GetTcpIPv6Statistics%2A> methods, to give applications access to TCP traffic information.
The information in this class correlates to the management information objects described in [http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2012.txt](http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2012.txt).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.NetworkInformation.TcpStatistics"></xref> class.
This constructor can be called only by classes that derive from the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.TcpStatistics> class.
Gets the number of accepted Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) connection requests.
IETF RFC 2012 formally defines this value as, "The number of times TCP connections have made a direct transition to the SYN-RCVD state from the LISTEN state."
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value that specifies the total number of TCP connection requests accepted.
Gets the number of Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) connection requests made by clients.
IETF RFC 2012 formally defines this value as, "The number of times TCP connections have made a direct transition to the SYN-SENT state from the CLOSED state."
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value that specifies the total number of TCP connections initiated by clients.
Specifies the total number of Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) connections established.
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value that specifies the total number of connections established.
Gets the number of current Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) connections.
IETF RFC 2012 formally defines this value as, "The number of TCP connections for which the current state is either ESTABLISHED or CLOSE-WAIT."
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value that specifies the total number of current TCP connections.
Gets the number of Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) errors received.
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value that specifies the total number of TCP errors received.
Gets the number of failed Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) connection attempts.

IETF RFC 2012 formally defines this value as, "The number of times TCP connections have made a direct transition to the CLOSED state from either the SYN-SENT state or the SYN-RCVD state, plus the number of times TCP connections have made a direct transition to the LISTEN state from the SYN-RCVD state."
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value that specifies the total number of failed TCP connection attempts.
Gets the maximum number of supported Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) connections.
If the maximum number of connections is dynamic, this property returns -1.
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value that specifies the total number of TCP connections that can be supported.
Gets the maximum retransmission time-out value for Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) segments.
TCP starts a retransmission timer when each outbound segment is passed to the network layer (IP).
If no acknowledgement is received for the data in the segment before the timer expires, the segment is retransmitted.

The timer can be set to any value between the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.TcpStatistics.MinimumTransmissionTimeout%2A> value and the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.TcpStatistics.MaximumTransmissionTimeout%2A> value.
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value that specifies the maximum number of milliseconds permitted by a TCP implementation for the retransmission time-out value.
Gets the minimum retransmission time-out value for Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) segments.
TCP starts a retransmission timer when each outbound segment is passed to the network layer (IP).
If no acknowledgement is received for the data in the segment before the timer expires, the segment is retransmitted.

The timer The timer can be set to any value between the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.TcpStatistics.MinimumTransmissionTimeout%2A> value and the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.TcpStatistics.MaximumTransmissionTimeout%2A> value.
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value that specifies the minimum number of milliseconds permitted by a TCP implementation for the retransmission time-out value.
Gets the number of RST packets received by Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) connections.
IETF RFC 2012 formally defines this value as, "The number of times TCP connections have made a direct transition to the CLOSED state from either the ESTABLISHED state or the CLOSE-WAIT state."
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value that specifies the total number of reset TCP connections.
Gets the number of Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) segments sent with the reset flag set.
TCP resets are specified using the reset (RST) control bit in the TCP header.
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value that specifies the total number of TCP segments sent with the reset flag set.
Gets the number of Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) segments received.
This data includes segments with errors and segments received on currently established connections.
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value that specifies the total number of TCP segments received.
Gets the number of Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) segments re-sent.
TCP segments that are not acknowledged as being received at the destination are retransmitted.
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value that specifies the total number of TCP segments retransmitted.
Gets the number of Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) segments sent.
This data includes segments sent for currently established connections but does not include segments containing only retransmitted octets.
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value that specifies the total number of TCP segments sent.
